0: A software that creates raster images
A software that creates vector images
1: To create a fixed size canvas click `Open -> New Canvas`
To create a fixed size canvas click `File -> Document Properties`
To create a fixed size canvas click `Layer -> Add layer`
To create a fixed size canvas click `Create -> New Document`
2: Use 'Move Tool' to arrange the size and position of the image
Use 'Select and Transform Object Tool' to arrange the size and position of the image
Use 'Edit path by Node Tool' to arrange the size and position of the image
Use 'Zoom in or out Tool' to arrange the size and position of the image
3: The default file format of this software is `jpg`
The default file format of this software is `xcf`
The default file format of this software is `svg`
The default file format of this software is `gif`

0: The position and colour of every dot in the canvas is recorded in a Vector File
Only the position and colour of the end points of an image are recorded in a Vector File
Only the colour of an image is recorded in a Vector File
Only the size of an image is recorded in a Vector File
1: Pictures are considered as a group of pixels
Pictures are considered as group of colours
Pictures are considered as a great single pixel
Pictures are considered as geometrical forms as lines, circles and curves
2: If the image expands, the new dots in the expanded canvas will be found out and recorded
If the image expands, the old canvas will be erased
If the image expands, the coloured dots will also be expanded
If the image expands, the background colour will be changed
3: The clarity decreases when the image is zoomed in
The colour will change when the image is zoomed in
The clarity sustains when the image is zoomed in
The shape will alter when the image is zoomed in

0.question: Open Geogebra software and mark two points in it (A,B). Draw an angle in the point A which can be controlled by a slider. Draw a circle with the point created by the slider as its centre and connects the point B. Apply trace to the circle and create a pattern by moving the slider. Save the construction in the folder Exam10 in Home with your register number_question number as its file name. [img](10/geogebra-1.png)

1.question: Open Geogebra software and mark two points in it (A,B). Draw an angle in the point A which can be controlled by a slider. Draw a circle with the point created by the slider as its centre and connects the point (A). Apply trace to the circle and create a pattern by moving the slider. Save the construction in the folder Exam10 in Home with your register number_question number as its file name. [img](10/geogebra-2.png)

2.question: Draw a circle in Geogebra software using the tool: Circle with center and radius. Draw a pattern in the circle as shown in the image given ( no need to follow the measurements ). 3.question: Draw a line in Geogebra software and mark a point in it (Point C in the picture). Draw a circle with this point as its centre and the radius of which can be controlled by a slider. Mark the two points of inter section of the line and the circle (D,E). Draw two circles with these points (D,E) as centres connecting the central point C . Apply trace to the two circles drawn and move the slider. Save the construction in the folder Exam10 in Home with your register number_question number as its file name. [img](10/geogebra-4.png)

8.question:
The school authorities have decided to create a web page in connection with “ World Water Day ” celebrations to include in the school web site. Design a web page as shown in the template given, using KompoZer software.
  • Set the caption “World Water Day 2014 " as the page heading
  • Insert the image water_logo.jpg from the folder Images10 in Home in appropriate place
  • Save the file in the folder Exam10 in Home with your register number_question number as its file name.
[img](10/kompozer-1.png)

9.question:
Open the web page MathsClub.html saved in the folder Exam_documents in Home in KompoZer software. Make changes in the page as suggested below
  • Give background colour to the page.
  • Set the first line as the page heading and place it at the centre of the page
  • Link the phrase “ Famous mathematicians ” given in the page to the web page Mathematicians.html saved in the folder Exam_documents in Home
  • Save the file using the option Save As in the folder Exam10 in Home with your register number_question number as its file name.
